author: A_Brickset_user
title: Don't really like it
review:
This is another set of the 80s to early 90s range. It''s not assembled like most of my other old (pre 1996) sets. But I've still all or almost all pieces for these somewhere in my collection
Now to the review:
This set isn't that great compared to other old classic town sets. It's a bit simple and unrealistic, but it even has two minifigures, which is much for such a small set. Both are classic smiley faces, like in all town sets before 1992 The plane is an ultra light one, which I don't like so. It's very easy to build, but definately not juniorized, like all town sets before 1997.
But since it's kinda unrealistic it's only a 7/10 to me

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Ultra Light
review: Around 1990 all products got a light version, cola-light, lowfat butter, lowfat mayonaise. I was astonished to see that even Lego made a ultra light set. the design is a bit unstable but its nice. Its great that it has 2 figs.

author: BobyDick
title: My very first Lego set
review:
This was my very first Lego set... it was a gift for my 4th anniversary, so i received the set in 1991... this set is very simple, with very few bricks... but i was very happy because this set have two figs, so it was perfect for me, because i was 4 and of course i played with them a lot... in my oppinion this set was perfect for my age... thanks mom! :p


I give to this set 4, maybe too much, but being my very first set i had some feelings for him...

author: AETerry
title: Ultra Lite I Review
review:
Being a small set, this fell into the price range of affordable for a child saving up their own money to buy a lego set or as impulse.

 

As I was very much so on a phase of get all the Lego sets I could, this set was picked up as part of that mind-set and I think to try and fill out or attempt an air field for the other Lego Planes that I have.

 

You get two minifigures, a radio control/direction on the ground and the pilot of the small Ultra Lite.

 

I know they've made planes that are Ultra Lites that are to be as minimal and light weight as possible in design yet still carry a person and fly. This set seemed to fullfill those expectations, but I've never really been sure. But as it's lego, I've always just kind of gone with it. It wasn't one of Lego's best designs.
